授業目的:
1. To introduce the main religions in present day Japan by examining their roots and historical developments.
2. To discuss cultural expressions of religious commitments, e.g. pilgrimage, architecture and art.
3. To polish the academic skills of the participants through assignments related to the course.
到達目標:
1. The participant can outline the history and ideas of the major religions in Japan.
2. The participant can discuss cultural phenomena related to religions.
3. The participant can produce an academic paper dealing with an aspect of the general topic.

Face to face format. The class structure of this course will be: short lecture on the topic, class discussion and participation and summation on the issues. Students will be expected to have read the assigned materials prior to the class and prepare to respond to the questions raised in the class. Additionally, students will be expected to be ready for briefing articles and cases in the course materials and will be prepared to discuss on those articles and cases.

第1回: 04/13 Introduction to the course including the book and the grading system.  Talk about our own experiences with religion(s) and the religious anywhere in the world. Discussion about what you want to gain from this course and any particular interest(s) you bring into it.

Check the Homepage of the course on LUNA when you have access to it.
